title: (x) Milton Glaser's I Love NY font
content:
Regarding this old thread:   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42156.html?1091741054](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053802/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42156.html?1091741054)   
   
I wonder if soemone could elucidate? The consensus seems to be that Glaser used American Typewriter Bold - a "no-brainer." But the version on Milton Glaser's web site:   
 [http://www.miltonglaser.com/projects/logos.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111016053802/http:/www.miltonglaser.com/projects/logos.html)   
as well as every version I have ever seen, is slightly different. ITC American Typewriter has a lot more color than Glaser's version.   
   
Any ideas?
author: danlevenson

comments.content: The logo looks more like American Typewriter Medium than bold. But he also might have had it re-inked since it's a logo.
